page.title: 07Kingford Farm.(Tavistock)2
page.content: The beef cattle are the male calves of his dairy cows and are born between August and March. When they are born they are fed on hay and milk.From the second winter onwards they have hay and kale.The farmer sells most of his cattle direct to the food processors. Mr.Blowey keeps 40 beef cattle.There are 170 sheep on the farm.The lambing season is from February to March.His ewes have one or two lambs each per year.During lambing the sheep are brought closer to the house.The farmer dips his sheep twice a year in August and October.The only crop grown by Mr. Blowey is kale which he uses to feed his cattle in the winter.He grows the kale as a rotational crop as it gives the field a rest from growing grass and leaves some goodness in the soil.
